name: Radisson Blu Resort Fiji Denarau Island

reviews.text: Just returned from 10 nights at the Radisson and we can't wait to go back!! There was 7 of us travelling my husband and I plus 3 young kids (1yrs,3yrs,5yrs) along with my Mum and Dad (Nana & Poppy). We took a 2 Bedroom Lagoon suite and Mum and Dad took a Lagoon Room (rms 101/102 & 103) Amazing would be a good description to start with, our rooms overlooked the waters and were next to the restaurant and pools!! Upgrade to a Lagoon if you can stretch the budget!! I used to work in travel and have travelled extensively around Australia and overseas so I can honestly say I had high expectation before we left and they were all happily granted upon arrival. A few bullet points - rooms are all huge, comfortable, sound proof and make life very easy with a young family - top loader washing machines and dryers, small dishwasher and microwave/fridge, 2 plate electric cooker. Few things I would recommend if travelling with young kids - take snacks,biscuits, crackers, noodles, pretty much most things you can take except honey or fruit, meat and veg - just declare it going through upon arrival into Nadi. Water Ice blocks that you can freeze (i.e juice) are great because buying ice creams can get a little expensive and a treat for the kids between meals or when it is hot. Big things that made a difference for us - food is not that expensive on the deli lunch menus $8fj for a sandwich $15-22 for a burger or stirfry...they always have an alternative menu for the kids which is cheap and offers great choice..plus they help fill special requests if you have a fussy eater.... They have a small store behind reception with egg/bread/wine/beer/snacks/ham/bacon/cheese lots of small things you could make a meal with...I wouldn't bother going down to the Marina to shop you don't save any $$ in the end and just get more than you need. You can buy water from their shop it is the same cost as the Marina and cheaper than getting it duty free - plus you don't have to carry it! The Japanese Asian restaurant near reception is outstanding, fresh and cheap. Radisson buffets are the best along the resort Strip from $64 fj pp kids under 4yrs eating with parent are free. The Sheraton buffet was terrible $88fj pp food choice limited and turnover limited so I would recommend eating at the Radisson. Our kids are up early so we did most bfasts in our room toast cereal. Fresh fruit and veg is very limited unless eating in the restaurant so keep expectations low on buying lots to cook in room with. Kids club girls are fantastic and our 3 boys loved visiting they do most of there activities around the resort and on the beach. Beaches are fine, sand grey/dark, but the sound of the waves is beautiful in the afternoon. Fish and Chips cheap and great location for a sunset drink. Must do -10am-12pm and 2-4pm $20fj massage by the beach for 20 mins the girls are amazing and so cheap!! Day trip out to one of the Islands - if you want Castaway book early or before you go because we could get on because it was booked out. 1/2 day Nemo trip good but rushed stay for lunch if you can afford or if your kids are older. Take suncreen and zinc and put it on the kids before kids clud. Lastly, it is very relaxed over there so pack your bag, take everything out and take a quarter of what you think you need. If you have chosen the Radisson you will have a great holiday. The resort staff are brilliant and can't help you enough, they know how to make you feel welcome and special....We have already booked for next year and are counting the days.
reviews.title: RADISSON FIJI - BEST RESORT CHOICE ON DENARAU ISLAND

reviews.text: My 2 adult children and I spent 4 nights at the Radisson before going to Musket Cove Resort. I'll note below the good and bad points about the hotel, first the good.
reviews.title: Rooms great, food not the best, noise from Sheraton generator deafening

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was clean and spacious, we had a one bed suite, situated on the Sheraton side of the hotel. It was great to have a kitchen, washing machine, dryer, dishwasher and full fridge.
reviews.title: Excellent Value Hotel

reviews.text: Food and service at Cross restaurant was good. Breakfast food was mainly good. When we rang housekeeping about lack of towels after room serviced they were quick and efficient. TV remote control was fixed 6 hours after arriving, they brought it back to the room about 10pm when were were nearly asleep! Mainly the service of porters, reception staff and housekeeping was good.
reviews.title: Fantastic Pools, Fantastic Food, Friendly People

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pools looked lovely but very crowded most of the time. Beds comfortable. Hotel is mostly very clean. Never saw any dead birds as others have mentioned but saw many African Mina Birds at the restaurant around the breakfast. Saw no native birds, probably because if the pesty Mina birds were poisoned then the native birds probably had the same fate.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel and a perfect way to unwind
Murdering Native Birds!
reviews.text: Nice Hotel. But every early morning they poison all the birds so there are dead and dying birds. They try to clean them up before people get up. But you can find birds dying slowly sitting in their own faeces or dead. So if you don't mind supporting the meaningless slaughter of innocent wild life - it is a good place to stay. But there are other way nicer resorts in Denarau than the Radisson which don't poison the bird life.

First overseas trip with our 10 yr old daughter. All she wanted to do was swim and the Radisson provided the best pools for kids. Plenty of time to relax and chillout. The hotel deli was fantastic with a good selection of wine & deli items. It was pleasant to be able to cook a family meal in our kitchen. All you want sometimes is something basic to eat, eg: pasta, tomatoes & mince. All of which can be bought at the very clean supermarket in Port Denarau. Your tummy will feel like some basic foods after a couple of days.
reviews.title: Prepare to relax

reviews.text: Day trips are easy to organise. There's plenty to see. The Nadi markets and village visits are a must. Take the kids and let them see how good they've got it back home. Take the local bus into Nadi. 50c ticket provides a ride you'll never forget.
reviews.title: absolutely fantastic and relaxing at the same time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downside of our visit was observing the rudeness of other guests towards the staff (who only earn $2 -$3hr). Jeez....some people just don't get it. Prepare to relax in style.
reviews.title: best holiday ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed there with 2 children three and five.our room was spacious, clean and with all the modern necessities.the friendly staff was great,.close to the port,the bulla bus would come frequently and you can just hop on and off as you need. the pool areas were great and the kids had so much fun,we relaxed even with two young kids, they loved the kids club, and it would give my husband and i a chance to have a massage or simply just relax by the pool.we highly recommend the radisson,and would not hesitate to go back there.
reviews.title: Could not be faulted, Simply the best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the resort at night time, and wow. Were we blown away by the place. There was fire lanterns everywhere and the massive waterfall was amazing.
reviews.title: As soon as we got there, we were blown away by how amazing it looked.. and this continued on through our stay!

reviews.text: As soon as we arrived the staff were ready to greet us and help us out with our booking. The room was exceptional and the bed was massive. We had a garden view, but that was still pretty amazing. The view of the mountains was great to wake up to.
reviews.title: Holiday in Paradise

reviews.text: We loved the buffet breakfast at the radisson, but found that it was something that wasn't too affordable for Us (in our situation) to do every day so we found that the hotel on the left side (not the Sheraton) did a great breakfast which fed both us for $10 AUD.
reviews.title: Wonderful 5 star resort, great for families.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also tried a night out at the restaurant in the pool (hard to describe).. and that was at the Radisson. It was one of the coolest experiences I've ever had whilst eating dinner and the food was fantastic.
reviews.title: Still Awesome!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only down side to the Radisson at the time was that the pizza oven at Neptune's fish and chips was broken down. However, it is a cheap taxi ride to Port Denaru to enjoy mama's pizza.
reviews.title: Fantastic holiday highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This resort is very family oriented but the adults area of the pool is a welcome retreat for couples. We enjoyed our stay despite how busy the place was with families. Food was OK and reasonably priced for a resort. We also ate at Port Denarau restaurants several times. The Cross restaurant at the resort was a bit hit and miss. One night we had great seafood for entree and main. Another visit saw us try the desserts - bad mistake. They were like frozen desserts from a supermarket tarted up to look like gourmet food or fine dining desserts. Terrible. That was about the only disappointment at the Radisson. The staff were lovely and seemed genuinely friendly and helpful. Another good point was the comfy huge bed - a must on holidays!
reviews.title: Busy but good resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms (apartments) are beautiful, modern, spacious with high quality tasteful fittings and furniture. They consist of a 1 bedroom hotel room and seperate key for 1 bedroom suite which has kitchen and lounge. Every room in the building is identical so doesnt matter where oyu stay, except for the view maybe. Swimming pools with sand beach entry are gorgeous. 5 reatuarants with so much variety from fine dinig to fish and chips on the beach, very high food quality. Prices are cheap with the Fijian dollar so low. Service is excellent, for Fiji. Even had free high speed inernet in the rooms. There is also a bottle store and shop on site. Loved it and would highly recommend.
reviews.title: Radisson resort Fiji is simply fabulous & we cant wait to return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At the end of a long round the world trip, this was the most perfect hotel imaginable before heading home down under. The setting is magnificent with lush tropical gardens; and the rooms, which are suites, are simply fantastic. The smiling faces of ALL the staff go a long way in telling the story of just how good this place is. The Cross restaurant is the finest dining experience you'll find in Fiji. Bar none!
reviews.title: Great Place in Fiji

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've been to Fiji many times, and we've been to Radisson before, and there's nowhere else in Fiji that we will consider in the Friendly Isles!
reviews.title: very enjoyable

reviews.text: We have just returned from a 6 night stay here. Its definitely the busiest resort on Denarau. We spent most of our time at the adults only pool which was great and quite sociable. The restaurants were all good and not too overpriced for a resort. We also took a taxi to the Port at night a few times ( $5 ) and ate there, which was also good. The drin ks here are a lot cheaper. The one bedroom suite is great and extremely spacious. We had breakfast in our room every morning, which we purchased at the resort Deli. Saved us a lot as beakfast at the restaurant is $ 32 pp and wasn't anything special.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we stepped into the Radisson we received a very warm and friendly welcome from the staff which continued throughout our stay. We stayed in the Guest Room with balcony overlooking the lagoon and the room was a good size with the largest and most comfortable bed. The lagoon and gardens are stunning, the eating areas well located with ocean views and we enjoyed the adult only pool area (but get there early for a deck chair). The buffett breakfasts offered a good selection of foods plus they cook your eggs to your liking, or you could have an omlete and the pancakes were delicious. We ate at the Cross where the food was of a high standard or if you wanted something casual the fish and chips or the pizzas were good at Neptunes. Don't miss the Happy Hours - two for the price of once cocktails, no wonder everyone gets happy. All the staff delivered exceptional service, all greeting you with 'Bulla' and willing to accommodate requests. The torch lighting ceremony held every evening gave the resort a special atmosphere. It also has a great area to sit and watch the sunsets. The beach is fine, just don't expect the pristine white sands and crystal clear waters for snorkelling, you need to take a trip to the islands for that experience but there were catamarans and kayaks available. The location is perfect as it is close enough to walk to the other resorts to try their restaurants or bars. We did have a meal at the Flying Fish (Sheraton) which was outstanding and also enjoyed their bar Chime which had lots of lounge beds to make yourself comfortable while having a drink and listening to the band. You could also catch the Bulla Bus FJD$6 for the day which would take you to the other resorts or to the marina which had a variety of restaurants/takeaways and a supermarket. Note most of the tours eg island hopping etc leave from Denarau (unlike the Coral Coast which had limited tours unless you were prepared to take the 3 hour round trip to Denarau). We could not fault this resort, we had such a memorable experience we can't wait to return to Fiji and will definitely be staying at the Radisson Resort again.
reviews.title: Memorable First Stay at the Radisson, can't wait to return!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the typical high standard resort and full of family's with screaming kids. Unfortunately parents seems to stop caring about their kids behaviour when on vacation = A LOT of noise around the pool area. The room was excellent, high standard and clean. The service was far from good. We arrived 4 hours before check-in and was promised a room when the first one was cleaned. This ended up taking 4 hours and the service of the staff at the reception was slim to none. All the restaurants, services and shops at the hotel is REALLY expensive. Costs 3-4 times as much as in the town.
reviews.title: High standard but too impersonal. Lots of kids.

reviews.text: Unfortunately Denarau Island has not much to offer if you want to see Fiji. It's a fake little world with golf-courses and gardens where everything is artificial. There is a shopping mall where half of the stores are closed and EVERYTHING costs twice as much as anywhere else on Fiji.
reviews.title: Highly recommended for holiday with young children

reviews.text: The beach has not much to offer and not suitable for snorkelling or diving. Hardly even swimming.
reviews.title: great family holiday
Hospitality Plus
reviews.text: Personally I would not recommend anyone to go to Denarau at all. If you want sun and beach there probably similar places a lot closer than Fiji.

My wife and I have just returned from our second trip to Fiji, staying at the always awesome Radisson on Denarau...Yet again the staff and the facilities were outstanding. This time around they had a full house and it was evident in the number of guests and little ones using the resort facilities. We stayed there in late Nov/Dec last year and found there to be less guests, possiblly due to Fiji's cyclone season commencing around that time....
reviews.title: RADISSON SHINES YET AGAIN - BUT AVOID LULU'S!!!

reviews.text: Weather was perfect with 28-30deg every day, not a cloud in the sky. Heat was a bit drier this time around, again due to the time of year. Lot less humid and in my opinion, a lot more enjoyable than that sticky humidity...Since our last visit, breakfast has improved with both bacon and has browns inclusive in the breakfast deal (last year they were extra!!) - bringing the Radisson into line with most of the other resorts on the island. I know that sounds picky, but I think most people expect those items to be available at this level of resort anyways.
reviews.title: Great Location, Nice resort and Wonderful Staff - very Kid Friendly

reviews.text: Again the food around the pool was great and despite the number of guests, delivered in a reasonable amount of time. Staff were abundant and always on hand to take your poolside orders. Unfortunately with all the guests and as indicated in previous posts, deckchairs by the pool were in hot demand. We rose early on a couple of occasions and by 8:30am, 3/4 of the chairs had towels or property 'reserving' them. There are signs warning guests that if left unattended for more than an hour, property would be taken to reception, but alas it was not policed. Chairs were regularly 'reserved' for 2-3 hours on some days...
reviews.title: Got sick...:-(

reviews.text: This time we ventured down to the port to eat and had a wonderful experience at Cardo's. I highly recommend this place for excellent quality, good value food, served in a catchy atmosphere with music, singers and alike. This place has a real buzz about it. Unfortunately we didnt share the same experience two nights later when visiting the adjacent Lulu's. The night we visited, Lulu's was about half full, approx 30 guests. After taking our order for entree and drinks, the drinks came quickly - but after 45mins, the simple garlic bread (our entree) failed to appear. The staff were apologetic, blaming the kitchen for the delay. Our mains order had not been taken and when we approached the apparent manager (tall, blonde haired middle aged women) she blew us off. Rather than approach our group and apologise, sent a staff member on her behalf....Suffice to say we left and ate at nearby Amalfi's Italian restaurant. This hadnt had rave reviews, but to say the least, the staff were attentive, the service time excellent and the food quality excellent.
reviews.title: Picture Perfect holiday

reviews.text: After doing the Seaspray and Castaway Is day trips last year, we decided to do the Mana Is day trip. We had a great day with snorkeling, Hobie cats and alike with a great buffet meal thrown in. This trip is great value for money.
reviews.title: Fantastic holiday destination!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a 8 night stay at Radisson Fiji and found it exceeded all of our expectations. The grounds and facilities are beautiful, the food is great and there is plenty to do both at the hotel and on Denarau.
reviews.title: Island Chill

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed during low season and the hotel was not at full capacity, though during the last few days of our stay there seemed to be more arrivals and space by the pool was hard to come by if you got there late in the day. The food was good, not the best that we had on the island, and other hotels such as the sheraton, westin and Hilton had better restaurants in my opinion. The Cross restaurant was the best at the hotel, and there were unique dining experiences such as dinning in a shallow pool. The breakfast was also very good.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were a few minor problems, but nothing that spoiled our holiday at all. Upon check in our room was not ready, so we had to wait roughly 30 mins before we could get into our room, though the staff were very apologetic. Our TV and dvd player didnt work properly and we had to call someone to fix it. The bathroom also seemed to have drainage issues, as when you used the sink or bath it took a little while for water to flow down the drain. Nothing major, just little things.
reviews.title: the worst ever - and we are frequent travellers with lots of experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all this hotel is what you would expect from a 4-5 star hotel. Cannot fault the large spacious rooms, the fantastic grounds or the super friendly and professional staff.
reviews.title: Relaxing holiday in Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to anyone really, though traveling as a couple as we were I would definitely not stay here during Australian school holidays. We stayed during the school term, but there were still plenty of children and families, which can be annoying when the pools look are over run during the day by toddlers. Overall, as one of the cheapest resorts on the island, you cant beat the value of this hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent value at the price

reviews.text: This was my visit to Denarau and I travelled with my wife and 2 young children (aged 3 and 4 months). I think everything has been pretty well canvassed in the reviews so I will just list my highlights. As a general comment I thought that the Radisson, given its size and the fact it was at full capacity, did a great job of hiding the numbers and at not feeling overcrowded. The pool area is fantastic, we had no issues with finding sun loungers.
reviews.title: Fantastic holiday - we will return !!

reviews.text: The one bedroom suite was faultless and perfect for a young family - right down to the Fisher & Paykel appliances and Methven Satinjet showerhead (just like home!). I would recommend asking your taxi driver to stop at one of the big supermarkets on your way from the airport to pick up some bottled water and whatever basics you need.
reviews.title: Sensational!! Beautiful resort with great facilities and friendly staff.

reviews.text: The babysitting services were excellent, we managed to secure the same babysitter for four nights and she was absolutely wonderful, especially with a four month old baby. My eldest daughter, who has a pathological hatred of all babysitters, even cried when she had to say goodbye. Tip them well, as they deserve it. We did the frog hunting and the torchlighting ceremony with the kids club, and they were only too happy to let you pick one or two activities and accompany your kids (if underage).
reviews.title: FANTASTIC

reviews.text: Food was okay but not amazing. The two exceptions being Cross and the seafood buffet next door at the Sheraton (Feast restaurant, Fri & Sat nights, FJD88). The buffet was a little pricey but easily the best food we ate whilst away. Treat yourself.
reviews.title: Perfect resort for kids...and parents

reviews.text: The bottle shop in the hotel is excellent if you run out of duty free, about FJD3 for a can of Fiji Bitter. Otherwise happy hour in the pool, and 2 for 1 cocktails, should get you by. We didn't spend a lot of time down at the Port, but ate at LuLus, which was alright. We did a half day South Sea "Finding Nemo" cruise which was enough given the age of our little ones.
reviews.title: Fabulous Resort just need a bigger adult pool!

aka: Radisson Blu Resort Fiji Denarau Island Hotel Denarau Island
description: Fiji's newest luxury beach front Resort offers a myriad of resort facilities nestled around lagoon swimming pools and lush tropical gardens combined with warm genuine Fijian hospitality. 270 luxuriously appointed and spacious guestrooms & suites combined with a contemporary and unique Fijian blend. Choose either a Guest Room or 1 & 2 Bedroom Suites with views of the Gardens, Lagoon or Ocean. Indulge in 5 lagoon swimming pools (one exclusively for Adults), Jacuzzis, Harmony Spa or free non motorised water sports.
